cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer.
explanation: The function increments scanner->curptr and then dereferences it (*scanner->curptr) without performing bounds checking against the end of the buffer. If scanner->curptr initially points to the last valid character of the buffer, the subsequent dereference will result in an out-of-bounds read, leading to undefined behavior, potential information disclosure, or denial of service.

cwe_description: The product reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer.
explanation: The code increments the scanner's current pointer (scanner->curptr) and then dereferences it again in the subsequent if condition (PJ_SCAN_IS_PROBABLY_SPACE(*scanner->curptr)) without performing a bounds check against the end of the buffer. This can lead to an out-of-bounds read if scanner->curptr points to the last valid character of a buffer and is then incremented past the buffer's boundary before the subsequent dereference.
